problem.markdown:
We often get questions about which types of work count as Core Contributor work. There is admittedly a blurry line at times, but often it is very clear.
>>Which of the following would count as valid Core Contributor hours? <<
[x] Doing prep work for a Working Group meeting [x] Attending a Working Group meeting, or catching up on a meeting (via recording or notes) if you can't attend synchronously [x] Performing follow-up work from a Working Group meeting [ ] Working on projects for my company's client [ ] Meetings within my company's team about projects our company is working on [x] Answering questions on the Open edX forums [ ] Giving a talk to my team [x] Recording a talk on a topic relevant to some part of the community, and posting it for the greater community to see [x] 1-1/synchronous collaboration time with other community members on work you're doing together [x] Working on a design, strategy, or other program that benefits the Open edX project but is not work that falls under my Core Contributor role (for example, working on translating the platform when you're a Product Manager) [ ] Using the knowledge or contacts I've gained through my Core Contributor role to try to gain new clients for my company
